scenario_text.value:
There! All set. Now I just need to wait for
Aoi.
Heheh, you’re in a good mood, Saki.

Why wouldn’t I be? It’s been forever since
the last time I cooked with Aoi. I’m psyched!
Oh, hey, Saki. Where’s Aoi?

Hi, Takuma. If it’s Aoi you’re after, she
went to the gym to check on our ingredients.

Oh, okay. So you’ve been getting things ready
here in the meantime.

You got it! I just got everything all set, so
we can start cookin’ any time!

You’ve really gotten better at this, huh? At
first, Aoi had to teach you everything.

Yeah, well, so what? Everyone’s like that
when they’re just getting started!

But now you and Aoi work together perfectly.
You’ve really come a long way!

Heheh, yeah, well, you know. When Aoi and
I work together, we’re unstoppable!

For sure. Anyone can see what a nice team you
two make. You get along great now!

(Aoi and Saki’s relationship, the way they
understand each other...feels so familiar.)
(You two are just like...)
Sisters.
Mother and daughter.
Best friends.
Sisters.
Sometimes, it feels like you two are sisters.
What?! You mean, Aoi and me?

Yeah. It comes through in how you get along,
and know what the other’s thinking...

You really think so? Aoi and me as sisters...
Eheheh, wouldn’t that be nice?

(She’s actually squirming, and with a smile
on her face! I’ve never seen her so happy.)

Heheh, you think if I called Aoi “Sis,” she’d
be surprised?

Oh, that sounds like fun! I want to do that
too.
Yeah, we’re all totally sisters now!

(Well, one thing’s for sure. Aoi’s in for
a pretty big surprise.)
Mother and daughter.

You know, you two remind me of a mother and
a daughter.

Ooh, and Aoi would be the mom, right? You
think of Aoi as an old lady, huh, Takuma?
What?! No! I didn’t mean it like that!

Ahaha, I’m just kidding. I get it. Besides,
Aoi seems used to being treated like a mom.

I just think you should be careful about
thinking of her like that too often.
She’s a girl too, you know?

I know, you’re right. I’ll be careful about
that.
Best friends.
It’s like you two are best friends.

Excuse me? What do you mean it’s LIKE we’re
best friends? We totally are!

Really? But isn’t a best friend a once in
a lifetime thing? Isn’t it hard to say that?

Nah, it’s real simple. If you think of
someone as your best friend, then they are.

And considering the life or death situation
we’re in, I’d say you’re all my best friends.
Including you, Takuma.

Oh, so...you think of all of us as best
friends? That’s...actually real nice to hear.

Heheh, you know, now that I’ve actually said
it, it does feel a little awkward.
See? That can make it hard to say, right?
Hey, Saki, what’re we having for dinner?
That’s a surprise!

But it’s going to be a real treat! You’re
gonna want to come hungry!

After all, this may be the last dinner we
have here.

True... So I’ll be looking forward to this
one!
Yeah! You better!

By the way, Saki, didn’t you say you thought
someone was at the table earlier?

Oh yeah! But there’s nobody there now, is
there?
Did you pass anyone on your way here, Takuma?
Uh... No, I don’t think so.
Huh. I guess I must’ve imagined it.
